title: Virtual Talk: Attention and Testimony in Works by Lorna Simpson
short_description:
Contemporary photographer Lorna Simpson first became known in the 1980s for work that confronted race, gender, and history. This participatory conversation, co-led by Sam Ramos, associate director of innovation and creativity, and Aneesah Ettress, curatorial and academic engagement intern at the University of Chicago’s Smart Museum of Art, considers Simpson’s combination of large-scale, multi-panel photographs and paired text in order to put word and image into a poetic dialogue.

This program is co-presented by the Smart Museum of Art, on the occasion of the exhibition Take Care.
list_description: Join this participatory conversation on word and image in the work of Lorna Simpson.

This virtual event will be hosted on Zoom. Find Zoom tutorials and resources here. If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
